recordTypes.name: Alcohol License  Draft test - NO  RECORDS
Auctioneer License
recordTypes.description: The application, a copy of your state Auctioneer License, and  $10.00 is required for a Town of Lexington Auctioneer License.

recordTypes.name: Street Performers Application
recordTypes.description: The Town Manager's Office will issue permits for Performers after an application process, and an annual fee of $25.00 is paid. Performances may take place Sundays through Saturdays 10:00am to 10:00pm with locations decided on first come first served basis.

recordTypes.name: Block Party Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Block Parties requests are made through the Town Manager's office with permission given by Department of Public Works when roads are to be blocked. Please note: no unsealed alcoholic beverages are allowed in any street which has a right of public access.

recordTypes.name: Patriots' Day Vendor Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits can be issued to charitable organizations within the Town such as religious, fraternal, civic, or student groups for vending locations on Patriots' Day each year in Lexington. Applications are due at least 3 weeks before Patriots' Day of the year requested and each Sponsor is allowed a maximum of 4 permits.

recordTypes.name: Historic Districts Commission Application for Formal Hearing
recordTypes.description: This is an application to attend a public meeting before the HDC to request a Certificate of Appropriateness for exterior alteration.

recordTypes.name: Historical Commission Application for Formal Hearing
Outdoor Dining Permit
recordTypes.description: Local restaurants in Lexington may apply for an Outdoor Dining Permit for sidewalk and private parking lot areas adjacent to their businesses. Fees for these permits are included as well as approval from necessary departments in town.

recordTypes.name: Automatic Amusement Device License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Automatic Amusement Device license for any type of device that you deposit a coin into and the game is put in motion to play.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Certificate
recordTypes.description: Short-term rental (STR) refers to the rental of any dwelling unit or bedroom as residential accommodation for a duration of less than 30 consecutive days. Short-term rentals are allowed within certain parameters, and there are rules and regulations you must follow to legally rent out your residence on a short-term basis. See Section 135-6.10 of the Code of Lexington Zoning Bylaws - Short-Term Rentals.

recordTypes.name: Certified Abutters List
recordTypes.description: Please note: Your Certified Abutters List will be available through this online portal after certification by the Assessor's Office. You can then download the Certified Abutters List, map, and related materials. If you require a Lexington Abutters List for an out-of-town address, please contact the Assessor's Office directly (781-698-4578).

recordTypes.name: Abbreviated Notice of Resource Area Delineation (ANRAD)
recordTypes.description: For confirming wetland resource area boundaries with the Conservation Commission. Conservation filings will not be reviewed and accepted until the meeting date filing deadline. Applicants can submit a filing before the meeting deadline date but the filing will not be accepted until the meeting date filing deadline.

recordTypes.name: Annual Fire Inspection and/or Drill - (includes Recreational Camp Programs)
Water Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any work on and existing or proposed water lines: services and/or mains. Only licensed drainlayers in Lexington may apply for this permit.   Fee=$100 for the first 50' plus .30/ft for longer lengths.

recordTypes.name: Commercial/Public Fire Drill Application
recordTypes.description: Commercial/Public property Fire Drill only. Properties that are required to have an Annual Inspection have their Fire Drill included with that application.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any work on and existing or proposed sewer lines: services and/or mains.  Only Lexington licensed drainlayers may apply for this permit.  Fee=$100 for the first 50' plus .30/ft for longer lengths.  A sewer stub fee may be due for a new connection.

recordTypes.name: Battle Green Permit
recordTypes.description: The Board of Selectmen issues permits for the use of the Battle Green. Please submit an application no less than two weeks prior to the requested date.

recordTypes.name: Amendment to Order of Conditions
recordTypes.description: Apply to make an amendment to an existing Order of Conditions. This process is required for any project that must be reviewed by the Engineering Department. Discretion is up to the Conservation Commission as to whether an amendment will be allowed or a new application process is required.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: This application must be completed, signed and submitted with the application fee by the applicant or representative in accordance with the Rules and Regulations of the Board. The applicant is advised to review the Lexington Zoning Bylaw and the Rules and Regulations of the Board of Appeals prior to filing this application. Petitioner or representative must attend the hearing.  Information provided on this page may constitute findings of fact.

recordTypes.name: Amendment to a Preliminary Site Development & Use Plan
recordTypes.description: Applications to amend an existing CD or RD districts adopted under previous versions of the zoning bylaw in effect on January 1, 2016.

recordTypes.name: 2025 Cultural District Grant Application
recordTypes.description: The goal for these funds is to help nurture arts and cultural initiatives and bring positive economic benefits to cultural institutions and local businesses while supporting Lexington's creative community in its ongoing pursuit of partnerships and financial resources.   You must be part of the Lexington Cultural District to receive funds through this grant.  All applications are due by March 28th 2025.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Application
recordTypes.description: The Town of Lexington is pleased to welcome a variety of special events, from community festivals to concerts and athletic competitions. It is the goal of the Town of Lexington to work with event managers and organizers to help ensure that the events taking place in our community are both safe and successful, while minimizing the impact on our residents and businesses.

recordTypes.name: Class I/II/III License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues licenses for Class I, II, and III dealers.

recordTypes.name: Public Records Request
recordTypes.description:
If you cannot find the public records you want in the resources provided, or by searching our Records Repository, you may request public records from the Town by filling out this online request form.  


Please note if you are currently logged into your Viewpoint Cloud, your name associated with that account will be available to the public.
 
If you would like to send an anonymous request, you may:

•Log out and create a new Viewpoint Cloud account adding only an email address. 
•Deliver to the records access officer by hand.
•Deliver via first class mail at the record officer's business address.
•Send by email

ALL requests for police related materials including Incident and Accident Reports, should ONLY be requested directly through the Police Department link and NOT through the OpenGov portal.  Requests pertaining to confidential and/or sensitive information should NOT be requested through OpenGov as this is a PUBLIC portal. 


If you have any questions please contact the Town Clerk's office at 781-698-4558. 

Please see our website for Department contact information: https://www.lexingtonma.gov.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Administrative Review
recordTypes.description: Administrative review of a minor project located outside of the 100 ft. wetland buffer zone or that meet specified minor project per Conservation Commission policy.

recordTypes.name: Trench Permit per MGL c 82a, Jackie's Law
recordTypes.description: Any work which creates a trench, as defined in 520 CMR 14.00 and MGL c. 82A, §§ 1 through 5,  requires a Trench Permit.  Fee=$50.

recordTypes.name: Drain Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any work on and existing or proposed storm drain lines: services and/or mains. Only Lexington licensed drainlayers may apply for this permit.  Fee=$100 for the first 50' plus .30/ft for longer lengths.

recordTypes.name: Bi-Directional Amplifier Permit- Installation or Alteration
recordTypes.description: For Residential and Commercial  Fire Alarm permits. Please note you may be required to submit plans with your permit application.

recordTypes.name: Common Victualler License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Common Victualler Licenses to establishments that cook, prepare and serve food at tables.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Certificate of Compliance
recordTypes.description: To apply for compliance following an Order of Conditions. Use this application for a Partial or Full Certificate of Compliance request.

recordTypes.name: Raffle & Bazaar Permit
recordTypes.description:
Application for permit to conduct raffles and bazaars. 

Initially when inputting an address (Step 2 of your application), please indicate the Location where the Raffle will be held. Later the application will ask for your business address.

recordTypes.name: Definitive Subdivision Plan
Definitive Subdivision Plan (Modification)
recordTypes.description: Application to modify previously approved Definitive Subdivision Plans or Approval

recordTypes.name: Tree Removal and Mitigation Permit  Final
recordTypes.description: This bylaw is enacted for the purpose of preserving and protecting  trees pursuant to Chapter 120 Town of Lexington By-Laws certain in regard to trees on portions of private property. To achieve these purposes, this bylaw establishes a Tree Committee and empowers the Committee, in conjunction with the Tree Warden, to regulate the removal and replacement of trees in certain circumstances, and to promote the planting and protection of trees throughout the Town. It is desirable that the Town plant more trees than are removed to compensate for tree losses and the length of time to maturity. The provisions of this bylaw, when pertaining to private property, apply only when there is major construction or demolition as defined below and only within setback areas.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Hazardous Tree Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply to remove any dangerous tree on your property that is bordering conservation land or is within the buffer zone of a protected resource.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Excavation Permit
recordTypes.description: A Right-of-Way Excavation Permit is required for any digging in the public right of way: streets, sidewalks and shoulders.  Only Lexington licensed excavators and drainlayers can apply for Right-of-Way Excavation Permits. Fee=$60 for the first 50' plus .30/ft for longer lengths. Right of Way Excavation Permits are not issued for non emergency work during winter moratorium as no road work is allowed during that time. It is from 11/15 to the day after Patriot's Day

recordTypes.name: Burn Permit
recordTypes.description: *** PLEASE NOTE ***  On the day you wish to burn, call 781-698-4700, press #8 after 9AM.  A recording will inform you if burning is allowed that day.  Following the message you will be asked to record your permit number.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Land Use Permit
recordTypes.description: To request the use of one of Lexington's Conservation areas for passive recreational events.

recordTypes.name: Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Entertainment Licenses to establishments that have theatrical exhibitions, public shows, public amusements and exhibitions of every description (including televisions).

recordTypes.name: Garage/Yard Sale Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for conducting private sales such as garage and yard sales.

recordTypes.name: Conservation Plan Modification/Insignificant Plan Change
recordTypes.description: To gain approval if possible for a plan change that deviates from the original approved plan as an insignificant plan change without any further legal posting or abutter notices. The Commission will generally discuss these requests during the 6:30 pm New Business/Pending Matters portion of the Conservation Commission Meeting Agenda.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater above Threshold
recordTypes.description: All construction disturbing greater than 1 ac requires to file a Stormwater permit with Engineering.

recordTypes.name: Limited Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Zoning Bylaw 135.9.5.6 Limited Review Standards for Dover Amendment Uses.

recordTypes.name: Cannon / Mortar Firing Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for Supervised Display of Fireworks.

recordTypes.name: Determination of Applicability
recordTypes.description: For work that falls under the jurisdiction powers as described by the Town of Lexington bylaws. Applications will not be reviewed until the application deadline. Applicants can submit an application for a deadline before the deadline date but will not be accepted until the application deadline.

recordTypes.name: License for Common Carrier
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Common Carrier Licenses for carrying of passengers for hire.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Obstruction Permit
recordTypes.description: A Right of Way Obstruction Permit is required to occupy the sidewalk or shoulder of a public right of way.  This permit is usually required for construction staging, dumpsters or pods, or placements of private overhanging signs. Fee=$50.

recordTypes.name: Body Art  Establishment Permit
Limousine License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Limousine Licenses for carrying of passengers for hire.

recordTypes.name: Emergency Certification Form
recordTypes.description: Please first contact the Conservation Director if an emergency comes up then apply for an Emergency Certification form which will be ratified at the next Conservation Commission meeting.

recordTypes.name: Cryogenic & Compressed Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: For storage of Cryogenics and Compressed Gases

recordTypes.name: Street Restoration Fee Payment
recordTypes.description: This is not a permit application.  This application is for payment of a street restoration fee related to a Right of Way Excavation permit.  This form should only be used for the non applicant to pay the fee online.

recordTypes.name: Lodging / Innholder License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Lodging/Innkeeper Licenses.

recordTypes.name: Open Space Residential Developments (OSRD)
recordTypes.description: Section 6.12 of Zoning Bylaw

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Subdivision Plan
One-Day Liquor License
recordTypes.description: MGL, CHAPTER 138, SECTION 14:  A One-Day Liquor License can be issued for the sale of wine and malt beverages to a responsible manager of any indoor or outdoor activity for profit or non-profit. One Day license applications should be submitted three weeks in advance to allow enough time to be processed and then approved at a Select Board meeting.

recordTypes.name: Extension to Order of Conditions
recordTypes.description: Request to extend the Order of Conditions beyond its expiration date

recordTypes.name: Fireworks Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for Supervised Display of Fireworks.

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm (Residential/Commercial) Permit
recordTypes.description: For Residential and Commercial  Fire Alarm permits. Please note you may be required to submit plans with your permit application.

recordTypes.name: Extension of Order of Resource Area Delineation
recordTypes.description: Request to extend the Order of Resource Area Delineation beyond its expiration date

recordTypes.name: Notice of Intent
recordTypes.description: Any project within wetland resource areas, including the 100 foot wetland buffer zone, and/or the 200 foot riverfront area is required to file for a Conservation Permit for review and approval by the Conservation Commission. When filling out the filing, please refer to the Massachusetts Wetlands Protection Act (M.G.L. C. 131, S. 40) as well as the Town of Lexington Wetland Protection Code (C. 130). Due to regulatory time periods, conservation filings will not be reviewed and accepted until the posted meeting date application deadline. Applicants can submit a filing for a deadline before the deadline date but the filing will not be accepted until the application deadline.

recordTypes.name: Sunday Public Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: A Sunday license is a license required for entertainment occurring on a Sunday that the public must pay a fee to attend and is part of the so-called "Blue laws.". Historically, activities that require a Sunday license include dancing or any game, sport, fair, exposition, play, entertainment or public diversion. G.L. c. 136, §4.

recordTypes.name: Modification to an Site Plan Review Approval
recordTypes.description: If you are requesting a modification to an exiting site plan review - use this application.

recordTypes.name: Fire Protection System Registration
recordTypes.description:
PLEASE POST SIGNAGE STATING 24 HOUR CONTACT INFORMATION NEAR FIRE ALARM PANEL.

 IF YOU DON'T HAVE A KEY BOX LOCATED AT THE FRONT OF YOUR BUILDING (near front door). PLEASE CONTACT KNOX BOX SYSTSTEMS TO ORDER A BOX. 

Please call 781-698-4705 if you have any questions.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Demolition - Interior
recordTypes.description: Use INTERIOR ALTERATION permit application for Residential Interior Demolition.

recordTypes.name: Flammables & Combustible Materials Storage Permit
recordTypes.description: For temporary or permanent storage of any Flammable and Combustible Liquids, Gases and Solids. Includes fuel storage in parking garages and Annual Permit to Maintain Storage of Flammables (Storage Tank Facility).

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Control Measures Certification
recordTypes.description: Submission form for commercial / industrial property owners for their annual Stormwater Control Measure (SCM) inspection and maintenance reports. This form is ONLY for non-residential property owners in Lexington, MA.

recordTypes.name: Modification to a Special Permit
recordTypes.description: Please use this application for any modifications to existing special permits or special permit residential developments.  Please consult with Planning staff to determine if your modification will be considered minor or major.

recordTypes.name: Theater License
recordTypes.description: The Select Board issues Theater Licenses to establishments that show movies.

recordTypes.name: Flammable Storage Licenses and Certifications of Registration
recordTypes.description: A License from the Town of Lexington Select Board is required to be in good standing  in addition to an Annual Certficiate of Registration from the Town Clerk's Office as well as a Flammables Permit from the Lexington Fire Department when: Annual Permit to Maintain Storage of Flammable Liquids - Tank Storage Facility is requested. -OR-Annual Permit for Flammables: Parking Garage is requested.-OR-Annual Permit to Store Flammables is requested and the applicant is storing in excess of the following:

recordTypes.name: Special Residential Development (SRD Sec. 6.9 of Zoning Bylaw)
Fuel Oil Equipment - Above Ground FUEL BURNING  Permit Install or Alteration
recordTypes.description: Application for all Fuel Oil Burner Modifications Installs and Removals

recordTypes.name: Street Adequacy Determination (SAD)
recordTypes.description: Please note that the trigger for a street adequacy determination has changed. Existing homes that are either adding on or are being torn down and replaced will no longer trigger a street adequacy determination. A change in use, or additional dwellings/units being added to what is existing will now be the trigger for street adequacy determinations.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Plan Review
recordTypes.description: The Board of Health has 30 days to provide feedback and approve, after  application is submitted.  Please return to your ViewPoint Cloud account to check the status and to ensure questions or comments are received.

recordTypes.name: Fuel Oil Equipment ABOVE GROUND OIL TANK  Installation or Removal
recordTypes.description: Application for all Oil Tank, Modifications, Installations or Removals

recordTypes.name: Demolition - Full Building
recordTypes.description: Only licensed Construction Supervisors can apply for a full building demolition permit. If you are a contractor who owns this property, please apply as a contractor, not as an owner.  The Tree Removal Permit Application can be submitted using ViewPoint Cloud: Tree Removal Permit Application. This Tree Permit permit must be issued by the Tree Warden before a building permit is issued.

recordTypes.name: Village & Multi-Family Site Plan Review (MFO, VHO, VO)
recordTypes.description: Applications for multi-family developments within the VO, VHO, and MFO overlay districts under Section 7.5 of the Zoning Bylaw.

recordTypes.name: General Fire Permits
recordTypes.description: For any Fire Permit not listed above as a stand-alone permit application.

recordTypes.name: Food Truck / Ice Cream Truck Permit
Hazardous Materials Processing Permit
recordTypes.description: For Hazardous Material Processing

recordTypes.name: Inspection Reports
recordTypes.description: Use this link to submit any Inspection Reports online.

recordTypes.name: Fossil Fuel Free Waiver Application
recordTypes.description: The Town of Lexington may grant a waiver subject to the requirements of the bylaw, “Regulating Fossil Fuel Infrastructure in Buildings” (Fossil Fuel Free Bylaw), in the event that compliance with the provisions of the bylaw makes a project financially infeasible or impractical to implement.

recordTypes.name: DRAFT COPY EDIT - Parking and Transportation Demand Management Plan  Approval Application  Copy
recordTypes.description: Development projects that elect to be in the Transportation Management Overlay Districts TMO-1 TMO-2 TMO-3 and those plans that have an MOU with the Select Board are required to submit Parking and Transportation Demand Management Plans for review and provide monitoring reports per the Zoning  Bylaw  §135-7.2 Transportation Management Overlay District and the Planning Board’s Regulations §176-10.2.  This application coincides but is separate from the Site Plan Approval Process.  This application is required if a Parking and Transportation  Demand Management Plan (large or small) is required.

recordTypes.name: Kitchen Hood or Clean Agent System Permit
recordTypes.description: For Kitchen Hood Suppression and Clean Agent System permits. Please note you will be required to submit plans with your permit application.

recordTypes.name: PROPANE:  Install/Remove Propane Tank, Temporary Storage of Propane, Retail Sales, or Storage Tank Facility
recordTypes.description:
Application for PROPANE:
Install or Remove Propane Tank
Temporary Storage of Propane
Retail Sales 
Storage Tank Facility

recordTypes.name: Lead Paint Removal/ Abrasive Sanding Permit
Insulation
recordTypes.description: Insulation work requires final inspection.  Please call 781-698-4510 24 hours in advance.

recordTypes.name: Smoke and Carbon Monoxide Compliance (26F For Sale/Transfer of a Property)
recordTypes.description:
FOR TRANSFER OF REAL ESTATE: Homeowners are required to have the Fire Department perform a Compliance Inspection for Smoke Detectors and Carbon Monoxide Detectors within 60-days of transferring property as regulated by M.G.L. Chapter 148 Sections 26F, 26F 1/2, and 527 CMR 31.00.
Call for a Re-Inspection, do not submit a new application.
IF LOW VOLTAGE SYSTEM OR SYSTEM WITH KEYPAD, APPLICANT NEEDS TO HAVE ACCESS TO KEYPAD WITH PASSCODE AT TIME OF INSPECTION.

recordTypes.name: Interior Alterations
recordTypes.description: This permit type would not include any exterior additions or expansion

recordTypes.name: Sprinkler (Residential/Commercial) Permit
recordTypes.description: For Residential and Commercial  Sprinkler permits. Please note you may be required to submit plans with your permit application.

recordTypes.name: New Construction
Underground Tank Removal and/or  Installation
recordTypes.description:
This application is for installation or removal of an UNDERGROUND storage tank. PLEASE GIVE A 72 HOUR NOTICE FOR UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK REMOVAL INSPECTION.

For ABOVE GROUND storage tanks, please use the Fuel Oil Equipment / Above Ground Fuel Oil & Propane Storage permit application.

recordTypes.name: Solar Panels
recordTypes.description: Solar Panels, be sure to include the structural engineering review and affidavit regarding, gravity and  wind loads and also include a dimensioned roof plan for Firefighter access routes.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Truck / Ice Cream Truck Permit
Tent
recordTypes.description: For temporary and outdoor dining tents.

recordTypes.name: Wireless Communication Equipment Installation
recordTypes.description: This includes wireless towers, antennas, and equipment repairs/replacement.

categories.name: Building Department
categories.content: As a governmental entity, the Massachusetts Public Records Law applies to records made or received by the Town. Any information received through use of this site is subject to the same provisions as information provided on paper. Otherwise, the Town does not share any personally identifying information with any third party.

categories.name: Conservation
categories.content:
PLEASE NOTE:
Once you open a permit, ALL communications from the Town of Lexington will be transmitted through this Opengov online application process. Requests for additional information, staff communications, requests for payment, change requests and document issuance will ONLY come from this portal. Payment for permits can only be made through this portal or by physical check presented to the appropriate Departmen

categories.content:
